page.title: 03EVENTS-BREACHING LOE BAR
page.content: In December 1984 the Bar was breached for only the third time in one hundred years.The Loe Pool level rose until Penrose walks were underwater.The adit from the pool to the sea was old and the pipes were always breaking and getting blocked up.The South West Water Authority dug a channel through the bar to let the water drain away. It was twenty feet deep and was scooped out by mechanical diggers and bulldozers. Many local people were not impressed because the Pool level dropped twenty feet and salt water mixed into the Pools fresh water.The sand barrier pushed up by the S.W.W.A to stop this happening was washed away.People were afraid that the plant and animal life of the Pool would be ruined by seawater.The operation cost Â£17,000.
